message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.CV. 

The paper focuses on developing a deeper understanding of recurrent neural networks, particularly LSTM/GRU-like networks, which are commonly used in machine learning applications such as natural language processing and image recognition. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also takes a system-theoretic perspective to design a new recurrent unit, which may fall under cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper discusses experiments on the adding problem, which is a common benchmark task in computer vision, suggesting a possible connection to cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition).
